description: Recorded since 1473, inherit +â€Ž -ance. More at inherit.

entries.meaning: The passing of title to an estate upon death.
(countable) That which a person is entitled to inherit, by law or testament.
(uncountable, especially linguistics, biology) The act or mechanism of inheriting; the state of having inherited
examples: The Indo-European languages share various similarities as a result of their inheritance from a common ancestor.

entries.meaning: (biology, genetic algorithms) The biological attributes passed hereditarily from ancestors to their offspring.
(programming, object-oriented programming) The mechanism whereby parts of a superclass are available to instances of its subclass.
